041/**
042 * Provides different utilities methods to apply processing from a security perspective.<br>
043 * <ul>
044 *     <li>These code snippet can be used, as "foundation", to customize the validation to the app context.</li>
045 *     <li>These code snippet were implemented in a way to facilitate adding or removal of validations depending on usage context.</li>
046 *     <li>These code snippet were centralized on one class to be able to enhance them across time as well as missing case/bug identification.</li>
047 * </ul>
048 */
049public class SecurityUtils {
050
051    /**
052     * Default constructor: Not needed as the class only provides static methods.
053     */
054    private SecurityUtils() {
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Apply a collection of validation to verify if a provided PIN code is considered weak (easy to guess) or none.<br>
059     * This method consider that format of the PIN code is [0-9]{6,}<br>
060     * Rule to consider a PIN code as weak:<br>
061     * - Length is inferior to 6 positions.<br>
062     * - Contain only the same number or only a sequence of zero.<br>
063     * - Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers.<br>
064     *
065     * @param pinCode PIN code to verify.
066     * @return True only if the PIN is considered as weak.
067     */
068    public static boolean isWeakPINCode(String pinCode) {
069        boolean isWeak = true;
070        //Length is inferior to 6 positions
071        //Use "Long.parseLong(pinCode)" to cause a NumberFormatException if the PIN is not a numeric one
072        //and to ensure that the PIN is not only a sequence of zero
073        if (pinCode != null && Long.parseLong(pinCode) > 0 && pinCode.trim().length() > 5) {
074            //Contain only the same number
075            String regex = String.format("^[%s]{%s}$", pinCode.charAt(0), pinCode.length());
076            if (!Pattern.matches(regex, pinCode)) {
077                //Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers
078                char previousChar = 'X';
079                boolean containSequence = false;
080                for (char c : pinCode.toCharArray()) {
081                    if (previousChar != 'X') {
082                        int previousNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(previousChar));
083                        int currentNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(c));
084                        if (currentNbr == (previousNbr - 1) || currentNbr == (previousNbr + 1)) {
085                            containSequence = true;
086                            break;
087                        }
088                    }
089                    previousChar = c;
090                }
091                if (!containSequence) {
092                    isWeak = false;
093                }
094            }
095        }
096        return isWeak;
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Apply a collection of validations on a Word 97-2003 (binary format) document file provided:<br>
101     * - Real Microsoft Word 97-2003 document file.<br>
102     * - No VBA Macro.<br>
103     * - No embedded objects.<br>
104     *
105     * @param wordFilePath Filename of the Word document file to check.
106     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
107     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/"
108     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/document/"
109     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/how-to.html"
110     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/embeded.html"
111     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/"
112     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.poi/poi"
113     */
114    public static boolean isWord972003DocumentSafe(String wordFilePath) {
115        boolean isSafe = false;
116        try {
117            File wordFile = new File(wordFilePath);
118            if (wordFile.exists() && wordFile.canRead() && wordFile.isFile()) {
119                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid Word 97-2003 format file
120                try (POIFSFileSystem fs = new POIFSFileSystem(wordFile)) {
121                    //Step 2: Check if the document contains VBA macros, in our case is not allowed
122                    VBAMacroReader macroReader = new VBAMacroReader(fs);
123                    Map<String, String> macros = macroReader.readMacros();
124                    if (macros == null || macros.isEmpty()) {
125                        //Step 3: Check if the document contains any embedded objects, in our case is not allowed
126                        //From POI documentation:
127                        //Word normally stores embedded files in subdirectories of the ObjectPool directory, itself a subdirectory of the filesystem root.
128                        //Typically, these subdirectories and named starting with an underscore, followed by 10 numbers.
129                        final List<String> embeddedObjectFound = new ArrayList<>();
130                        DirectoryEntry root = fs.getRoot();
131                        if (root.getEntryCount() > 0) {
132                            root.iterator().forEachRemaining(entry -> {
133                                if ("ObjectPool".equalsIgnoreCase(entry.getName()) && entry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
134                                    DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectory = (DirectoryEntry) entry;
135                                    if (objPoolDirectory.getEntryCount() > 0) {
136                                        objPoolDirectory.iterator().forEachRemaining(objPoolDirectoryEntry -> {
137                                            if (objPoolDirectoryEntry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
138                                                DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry = (DirectoryEntry) objPoolDirectoryEntry;
139                                                if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.getEntryCount() > 0) {
140                                                    objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.forEach(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry -> {
141                                                        if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.isDocumentEntry()) {
142                                                            embeddedObjectFound.add(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.getName());
143                                                        }
144                                                    });
145                                                }
146                                            }
147                                        });
148                                    }
149                                }
150                            });
151                        }
152                        isSafe = embeddedObjectFound.isEmpty();
153                    }
154                }
155            }
156        } catch (Exception e) {
157            isSafe = false;
158        }
159        return isSafe;
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Ensure that an XML file does not contain any External Entity, DTD or XInclude instructions.
164     *
165     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
166     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
167     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/xxe"
168     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#java"
169     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/security/java-api-xml-processing-jaxp-security-guide.html#GUID-82F8C206-F2DF-4204-9544-F96155B1D258"
170     * @see "https://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude-11/"
171     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XInclude"
172     */
173    public static boolean isXMLSafe(String xmlFilePath) {
174        boolean isSafe = false;
175        try {
176            File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
177            if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
178                //Step 1a: Verify that the XML file content does not contain any XInclude instructions
179                boolean containXInclude = Files.readAllLines(xmlFile.toPath()).stream().anyMatch(line -> line.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).contains(":include "));
180                if (!containXInclude) {
181                    //Step 1b: Parse the XML file, if an exception occur than it's imply that the XML specified is not a valid ones
182                    //Create an XML document builder throwing Exception if a DOCTYPE instruction is present
183                    DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
184                    dbfInstance.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
185                    //Xerces 2 only
186                    //dbfInstance.setFeature("http://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/features.html#disallow-doctype-decl",true);
187                    dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
188                    DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
189                    //Parse the document
190                    Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
191                    isSafe = (doc != null && doc.getDocumentElement() != null);
192                }
193            }
194        } catch (Exception e) {
195            isSafe = false;
196        }
197        return isSafe;
198    }
199
200
201    /**
202     * Extract all URL links from a PDF file provided.<br>
203     * This can be used to apply validation on a PDF against contained links.
204     *
205     * @param pdfFilePath pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to process.
206     * @return A List of URL objects that is empty if no links is found.
207     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing of the PDF file.
208     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
209     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
210     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
211     */
212    public static List<URL> extractAllPDFLinks(String pdfFilePath) throws Exception {
213        final List<URL> links = new ArrayList<>();
214        File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
215        try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
216            PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
217            AnnotationFilter actionURIAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
218                @Override
219                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
220                    boolean keep = false;
221                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
222                        keep = (((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction() instanceof PDActionURI);
223                    }
224                    return keep;
225                }
226            };
227            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
228                try {
229                    page.getAnnotations(actionURIAnnotationFilter).forEach(annotation -> {
230                        PDActionURI linkAnnotation = (PDActionURI) ((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction();
231                        try {
232                            URL urlObj = new URL(linkAnnotation.getURI());
233                            if (!links.contains(urlObj)) {
234                                links.add(urlObj);
235                            }
236                        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
237                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
238                        }
239                    });
240                } catch (Exception e) {
241                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
242                }
243            });
244        }
245        return links;
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Apply a collection of validations on a PDF file provided:<br>
250     * - Real PDF file<br>
251     * - No attachments.<br>
252     * - No Javascript code.<br>
253     * - No links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData.<br>
254     *
255     * @param pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to check.
256     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
257     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/36161267"
258     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
259     * @see "https://github.com/jonaslejon/malicious-pdf"
260     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
261     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
262     */
263    public static boolean isPDFSafe(String pdfFilePath) {
264        boolean isSafe = false;
265        try {
266            File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
267            if (pdfFile.exists() && pdfFile.canRead() && pdfFile.isFile()) {
268                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid PDF file
269                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
270                    //Step 2: Check if the file contains attached files, in our case is not allowed
271                    PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
272                    PDDocumentNameDictionary namesDictionary = new PDDocumentNameDictionary(documentCatalog);
273                    if (namesDictionary.getEmbeddedFiles() == null) {
274                        //Step 3: Check if the file contains Javascript code, in our case is not allowed
275                        if (namesDictionary.getJavaScript() == null) {
276                            //Step 4: Check if the file contains links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData, in our case is not allowed
277                            final List<Integer> notAllowedAnnotationCounterList = new ArrayList<>();
278                            AnnotationFilter notAllowedAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
279                                @Override
280                                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
281                                    boolean keep = false;
282                                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
283                                        PDAnnotationLink link = (PDAnnotationLink) annotation;
284                                        PDAction action = link.getAction();
285                                        if ((action instanceof PDActionURI)
286                                                || (action instanceof PDActionLaunch)
287                                                || (action instanceof PDActionRemoteGoTo)
288                                                || (action instanceof PDActionImportData)
289                                        ) {
290                                            keep = true;
291                                        }
292                                    }
293                                    return keep;
294                                }
295                            };
296                            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
297                                try {
298                                    notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.add(page.getAnnotations(notAllowedAnnotationFilter).size());
299                                } catch (IOException e) {
300                                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
301                                }
302                            });
303                            if (notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.stream().reduce(0, Integer::sum) == 0) {
304                                isSafe = true;
305                            }
306                        }
307                    }
308                }
309            }
310        } catch (Exception e) {
311            isSafe = false;
312        }
313        return isSafe;
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Remove as much as possible metadata from the provided PDF document object.
318     *
319     * @param document PDFBox PDF document object on which metadata must be removed.
320     * @see "https://gist.github.com/righettod/d7e07443c43d393a39de741a0d920069"
321     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
322     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
323     */
324    public static void clearPDFMetadata(PDDocument document) {
325        if (document != null) {
326            PDDocumentInformation infoEmpty = new PDDocumentInformation();
327            document.setDocumentInformation(infoEmpty);
328            PDMetadata newMetadataEmpty = new PDMetadata(document);
329            document.getDocumentCatalog().setMetadata(newMetadataEmpty);
330        }
331    }
332
333
334    /**
335     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
336     *
337     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
338     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
339     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
340     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
341     */
342    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
343        boolean isValid = false;
344        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
345        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
346        String work = targetUrl;
347        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
348            //Creation of a URL object must fail
349            try {
350                new URL(work);
351                isValid = false;
352            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
353                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
354                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
355            }
356        }
357        return isValid;
358    }
359
360    /**
361     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:<br>
362     * - Real ZIP file<br>
363     * - Contain less than a specified level of deepness.<br>
364     * - Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.<br>
365     *
366     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
367     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
368     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
369     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
370     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
371     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
372     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
373     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
374     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
375     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
376     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
377     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
378     */
379    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
380        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
381        boolean isSafe = false;
382        try {
383            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
384            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
385                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
386                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
387                    //Step 2: Parse entries
388                    long deepness = 0;
389                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
390                    String entryExtension;
391                    String zipEntryName;
392                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
393                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
394                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
395                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
396                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
397                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
398                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
399                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
400                            validationsFailed = true;
401                            break;
402                        }
403                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
404                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
405                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
406                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
407                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
408                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
409                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
410                                validationsFailed = true;
411                                break;
412                            }
413                        }
414                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
415                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
416                            validationsFailed = true;
417                            break;
418                        }
419                    }
420                    if (!validationsFailed) {
421                        isSafe = true;
422                    }
423                }
424            }
425        } catch (Exception e) {
426            isSafe = false;
427        }
428        return isSafe;
429    }
430
431    /**
432     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
433     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
434     *
435     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
436     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
437     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
438     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
439     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
440     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
441     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
442     */
443    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
444        String mimeType = null;
445        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
446            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
447            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
448            try {
449                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
450                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
451                    if (mt != null) {
452                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
453                    }
454                }
455            } catch (IOException ioe) {
456                mimeType = null;
457            }
458        }
459        return mimeType;
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an public IP address:<br>
464     * - Is a valid IP v4 or v6 address.<br>
465     * - Is public from an Internet perspective.<br><br>
466     * <b>Note:</b> I often see missing such validation in the value read from HTTP request headers like "X-Forwarded-For" or "Forwarded".
467     * <br>
468     * <b>Note for IPv6:</b> I used documentation found so it is really experimental!
469     *
470     * @param ip String expected to be a valid IP address.
471     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
472     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
473     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/InetAddressValidator.html"
474     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html"
475     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_Orange_Tsai_Talk.pdf"
476     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_SSRF_Bible.pdf"
477     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For"
478     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Forwarded"
479     * @see "https://ipcisco.com/lesson/ipv6-address/"
480     * @see "https://www.juniper.net/documentation/us/en/software/junos/interfaces-security-devices/topics/topic-map/security-interface-ipv4-ipv6-protocol.html"
481     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.base/java/net/InetAddress.html#getByName(java.lang.String)"
482     * @see "https://www.arin.net/reference/research/statistics/address_filters/"
483     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_address"
484     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/5619409"
485     * @see "https://www.ripe.net/media/documents/ipv6-address-types.pdf"
486     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments.xhtml"
487     * @see "https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/Inet6Address"
488     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address"
489     */
490    public static boolean isPublicIPAddress(String ip) {
491        boolean isValid = false;
492        try {
493            //Quick validation on the string itself based on characters used to compose an IP v4/v6 address
494            if (Pattern.matches("[0-9a-fA-F:.]+", ip)) {
495                //If OK then use the dedicated InetAddressValidator from Apache Commons Validator
496                if (InetAddressValidator.getInstance().isValid(ip)) {
497                    //If OK then validate that is an public IP address
498                    //From Javadoc for "InetAddress.getByName": If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
499                    InetAddress addr = InetAddress.getByName(ip);
500                    isValid = (!addr.isAnyLocalAddress() && !addr.isLinkLocalAddress()
501                            && !addr.isLoopbackAddress() && !addr.isMulticastAddress()
502                            && !addr.isSiteLocalAddress());
503                    //If OK and the IP is an V6 one then make additional validation because the built-in Java API will let pass some V6 IP
504                    //For the prefix map, the start of the key indicates if the value is a regex or a string
505                    if (isValid && (addr instanceof Inet6Address)) {
506                        Map<String, String> prefixes = new HashMap<>();
507                        prefixes.put("REGEX_LOOPBACK", "^(0|:)+1$");
508                        prefixes.put("REGEX_UNIQUE-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "^f(c|d)[a-f0-9]{2}:.*$");
509                        prefixes.put("STRING_LINK-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "fe80:");
510                        prefixes.put("REGEX_TEREDO", "^2001:[0]*:.*$");
511                        prefixes.put("REGEX_BENCHMARKING", "^2001:[0]*2:.*$");
512                        prefixes.put("REGEX_ORCHID", "^2001:[0]*10:.*$");
513                        prefixes.put("STRING_DOCUMENTATION", "2001:db8:");
514                        prefixes.put("STRING_GLOBAL-UNICAST", "2000:");
515                        prefixes.put("REGEX_MULTICAST", "^ff[0-9]{2}:.*$");
516                        final List<Boolean> results = new ArrayList<>();
517                        final String ipLower = ip.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
518                        prefixes.forEach((addressType, expr) -> {
519                            String exprLower = expr.trim().toLowerCase();
520                            if (addressType.startsWith("STRING_")) {
521                                results.add(ipLower.startsWith(exprLower));
522                            } else {
523                                results.add(Pattern.matches(exprLower, ipLower));
524                            }
525                        });
526                        isValid = ((results.size() == prefixes.size()) && !results.contains(Boolean.TRUE));
527                    }
528                }
529            }
530        } catch (Exception e) {
531            isValid = false;
532        }
533        return isValid;
534    }
535}
